description: University-preparation physics problems with detailed solutions covering advanced mechanics, electromagnetism, modern physics, and relativity. Master the most challenging concepts in secondary physics.

topics.name: Unit 1: Advanced Mechanics
topics.description: Advanced dynamics, non-inertial reference frames, Lagrangian mechanics introduction, and complex multi-body systems

topics.name: Unit 2: Gravitation & Satellites
topics.description: Universal gravitation, gravitational potential energy, Kepler's laws, orbital mechanics, escape velocity, and satellite motion

topics.name: Unit 3: Oscillations & Resonance
topics.description: Damped and forced oscillations, resonance phenomena, coupled oscillators, energy in oscillating systems, and applications

topics.name: Unit 4: Electric Fields & Potential
topics.description: Electric field calculations, Gauss's law, electric potential and potential energy, capacitance, and dielectrics

topics.name: Unit 5: Magnetic Fields & Induction
topics.description: Magnetic force on charges and currents, Amp√®re's law, Faraday's law, Lenz's law, inductance, and electromagnetic applications

topics.name: Unit 6: Alternating Current & Circuits
topics.description: AC analysis, RLC circuits, impedance, resonance in AC circuits, transformers, and power transmission

topics.name: Unit 7: Quantum Physics
topics.description: Photoelectric effect, wave-particle duality, de Broglie wavelength, uncertainty principle, quantum tunneling, and wave functions

topics.name: Unit 8: Atomic & Nuclear Physics
topics.description: Bohr model, atomic spectra, energy levels, nuclear structure, radioactive decay, half-life, nuclear reactions, and binding energy

topics.name: Unit 9: Relativity (Intro)
topics.description: Special relativity postulates, time dilation, length contraction, relativistic momentum and energy, mass-energy equivalence

topics.name: Unit 10: Review & Capstone Project
topics.description: Comprehensive review problems integrating multiple concepts, AP/IB exam-style questions, and real-world physics applications
